definition: The crime committed by a public official who, utilizing their official powers, illegally causes a person to perform an act that the person is not obliged to perform, or obstructs a person from exercising their rights.
japaneseDefinition: 公務員がその職権を濫用し、人に義務のないことを行わせ、又は権利の行使を妨害することによって成立する犯罪。
japaneseWordTranslation: 職権濫用罪 (しょっけんらんようざい)
legalContext: Criminal Code Art. 194 (Abuse of Authority): A public officer who, in the exercise of their authority, causes a person to perform an act which the person is not obliged to perform, or obstructs a person from exercising their rights, shall be punished by imprisonment with or without labor for not more than two years or a fine of not more than 100,000 yen.
japaneseLegalContext: 刑法第194条（職権濫用）：公務員が、その職権を濫用し、人に義務のないことを行わせ、又は人の権利の行使を妨害したときは、二年以下の懲役若しくは禁錮又は十万円以下の罰金に処する。
exampleSentence: The former police chief was indicted on charges of abuse of authority for using his position to halt an investigation into his associates.
exampleTranslation: 元警察署長は、自己の関係者に対する捜査を中止させるために地位を利用したとして、職権濫用の容疑で起訴された。
